author: Federico Cáceres

author: Diederik van der Boor
message:
Bravo for taking the courage to remove those buttons!
They are indeed not needed, and this looks much nicer now!

author: TheBlackCat
message:
I agree, it is much better.

However, there is a huge amount of wasted vertical space. Could you put the volume slider in a second row, and hide it if there isn't enough vertical space? Actually, if possible making both the sliders vertical might be better, although it may look weird and may not even be possible.

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: I thought about it, but I was worried it would look a bit ugly. Additionally, the same widget is also used to display videos, in which case vertical space is used.

replies.author: molecule-eye
replies.message: Esactly: too much wasted space. It would be cool if different-sized preview panes (size depending on the kind of file) popped out *only* when the user hovers over the file. Hovering over an audio file would cause only a small control panel to pop out with play, stop, etc.

author: Bernhard
message: Yes, *much* better.

author: Syam
message: That's good work. Thanks to this post, I just discovered that I can preview files from the file open dialog :-) Video previews are quite nice.

author: J
message: Well done!

author: Jucato
message: The stop button is redundant anyway since you can have a play/pause button in one widget. I'm just wondering though, isn't it possible to simply have the volume slider be simply an icon which will then drop down to reveal the slider, like something that you have in KMix in the system tray?

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: Yes, that would probably work. What would be nice would be to have the slider visible if there is room and replaced by a button if the slider takes too much space. I am not motivated enough to do it right now though. Feel free to give it a try :)

author: montfras
message:

replies.message:

author: dieppe
message:
As everybody said before, nice improvement. However, I'm not sure it's a good idea to hide the volume slider if there is not enough horizontal space, as it might confuse some users (I used to have a volume slider, I don't have one now, where the heck is it gone?!).

I don't have any idea though, but just thought it was worth noticing.

replies.author: Fri13
replies.message:
That is exactly what I fear most. I am not sure what HIG says about hiding elements by the widget size, but I am just guessing that is not allowed as it caused confusion.
But even now when comparing the current and this new structure. This new one rocks totally.

message: It would be really nice to have such an “Play automatically” checkbox in dolphins information panel. Before KDE SC 4.0 I was a gnome user and there if you hover a audio file it plays automatically and I really miss that feature in KDE.

replies.message:
>if you hover a audio file it plays automatically and I really miss that feature in KDE.

You will be surprised but this is already works fron the box (checked with 4.4.5 and 4.5.3 on Debian and Kubuntu)

Fedora 14 KDE 4.5.3
http://imagebin.ca/view/B7H...

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: That is normal. The preview code is not shared between Dolphin and the file dialog. Maybe it should be.

replies.author: Mac
replies.message: It would certainly be great if it could be ported to the file browsers (Dolphin, Konqueror). This feature (last seen in KDE3 and currently in nautilus) is sorely missed.

author: Gres
message:
Those small usability improvements are the ones that make a big difference between a computer being easier to use or not. Microsoft still doesn't learn how to do it, and Apple did it ten years ago. Thank you Gateau!

The seek slider icons was really a weird thing.
When there is a video, the used space is ok, but when there is only audio, I think that the controllers should be put under the files list, so the horizontal space is used more efficiently.

I also think that the guys doing the icons should complete first the missing ones, there is nothing worse that an interface fully with ? icons. (or instead use the tango icons, until the oxygen are complete.)

author: Kevin Kofler
message: For the looping, what about a "[] Play in a loop" checkbox below? There's plenty of vertical space and that way we wouldn't lose the feature (and a checkbox would solve the problem of the bad icon, too).

replies.author: Markus
replies.message:
Sounds like a good idea to me. However for SC 4.6 string freeze passed.
@Aurélien: What about the previous setting? Is to loop or not to loop saved in some config file? If yes, some people may have had loop activated in SC 4.5 and now can't disable it.

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: No, it was not saved, so it shouldn't be a problem.

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: I think this feature is not needed for such an interface. The Dolphin preview doesn't even have a volume slider! I would rather fill the space with some meta information such as duration, sample rate or number of channels...

author: Martin Klapetek
message:
Good work, thanks! Although as others have already pointed out, there's still too much wasted vertical space (well it was there before, but when it's changing... ;)

The visualization would be an awesome thing. Also about the volume, why not switch to something like Amarok's circular volume control when low space? Otherwise keep the slider.

Just my two cents.. ;)

author: Mick
message: Go, go, go! More of these. There is so much unneeded clutter and junk in KDE GUIs these days that I can only support someone cleaning it up. Perhaps I can one day come back to KDE.
